description.lang: Z-Wave Controlled door lock with keypad, and Bluetooth Smart.Operated by Z-Wave.Connect Danalock to your Z-Wave gateway -Danalock interfaces with your existing Z-Wave network through the Danalock smartphone app.Operate Danalock remotely by accessing your Z-Wave network from anywhere in the world with internet access.
Z-Wave Plus Lifeline
This value is ignored if there is a rotation sensor. 0 = The motor goes clockwise when latched 1 = The motor goes counterclockwise when latched.
The motor goes counterclockwise when latched
The motor goes clockwise when latched
0 = Disabled. 1-15 Seconds to brake. When used the lock will brake for x amount of seconds and then turn 75 degrees back. Made for special doors without door lever.(Only when unlatching).
Disabled
Seconds to brake. When used the lock will brake for x amount of seconds and then turn 75 degrees back. Made for special doors without door lever.(Only when unlatching).

0 = Async off, 1 = Async on. Used if the lock is using an optional rotation sensor. When async is enabled the lock will auto calibrate if already unlatched and asked to Unlatch again (used for special door locks where the key turn is asynced from the inside nob.)
Async off

Async on. Used if the lock is using an optional rotation sensor. When async is enabled the lock will auto calibrate if already unlatched and asked to Unlatch again (used for special door locks where the key turn is asynced from the inside nob.)

DEPRECATED. 0 = Simple supported by all controllers that support door locks. 1 = Advanced, more specific reports through notification Command Class. 2 = No Door lock operation reports are sent unsolicited. Should not be used. Use Notification CC enable instead.
No Door lock operation reports are sent unsolicited.
Simple supported by all controllers that support door locks.
Advanced, more specific reports through notification Command Class.
1 = Slowest 2 = Slow 3 = Normal 4 = Fast 5 = Fastest
Slow
Normal
Fast
Fastest
Slowest
DEPRECATED. 0 = Stepper motor mode wave drive(power saving) 1 = Stepper motor mode full drive(Normal) 2 = Relay mode
Stepper motor mode full drive(Normal)
Relay mode
Stepper motor mode wave drive(power saving)
This value is ignored if there is a rotation sensor. Factor 10 turn degrees ( 1 = 10 degrees, 9 = 90 degrees etc.)
Factor 10 turn degrees ( 1 = 10 degrees, 9 = 90 degrees etc.)
How many seconds from the lock has been unlatched to it automatically should close again. If 0 then it is disabled.
How many seconds from the lock has been unlatched to it automatically should close again. If 0 then it is disabled.
Disable or enable the beep sound from latch or unlatch operations(0 = Disable, 1 = Enable.)
Enable the beep sound from latch or unlatch operations
Disable the beep sound from latch or unlatch operations

Set the type of battery that powers the device. This affects the returned battery state. 0 = 3,6 Volt battery, 1 = 3.0 Volt battery. 2 = Mains power, changing from and to mains power requires the Danalock to be excluded and included.
Mains power, changing from and to mains power requires the Danalock to be excluded and included.
3,6 Volt battery
3.0 Volt battery.
When the battery level is under this value, the device will notify user with a beep sound after latch or unlatch.
When the battery level is under this value, the device will notify user with a beep sound after latch or unlatch.
0 = Turn&Go off, 1 = Turn&Go on. Used if the lock is using a optional rotation sensor. Latch&Go on will turn automatically when manual turn is detected.
TurnAndGo on will turn automatically when manual turn is detected.
TurnAndGo off
